file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-61-01-04 - LANDING GEAR UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LANDING GEAR UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures for the removal/installation and deactivation/reactivation of the uplock proximity switches of the landing gear system. B. This procedure is applicable to the six uplock proximity switches. C. The uplock proximity switches are installed in the uplock boxes of the main (LH and RH) and nose landing gears. Each uplock box has two proximity switches. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - REMOV- ALL 32-61-01-000-801-A AL UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - INSTAL- ALL 32-61-01-400-801-A LATION UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - DEACTI- ALL 32-61-01-040-801-A VATION PROCEDURE UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - REACTI- ALL 32-61-01-440-801-A VATION PROCEDURE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-61-01 Page 1 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-61-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the uplock proximity switches of the landing gear system. (2) If the electrical connector (3) or (4) presents signs of damage, contamination or corrosion, do the maintenance procedures on the electrical connector as follows: To clean the electrical connector, refer to WM 20-50-00/201. To replace the electrical connector, use the repair kit. Refer to IPC 32-61-00. Obey the instructions of the applicable Wiring Manual, Chapter WM 20-50-00/201, Standard Practices. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL LANDING GEAR PROXIMITY SWITCH AND HAR- AMM TASK 32-60-00-910-801-A/200 NESS ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS - RESTORATION AND PROTECTION IPC 32-61-00 LDG INDICATION SB145-32-0036 - WM 20-50-00/201 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-61-01 Page 2 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Nose landing gear or RH or LH MLG com- 1 Does the task partment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system No. 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (2) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, install safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open the IND 1 and IND 2 circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (4) Make sure that the safety pins of the landing gears are installed ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). (5) Identify the proximity switch to be removed. J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A NOTE: This procedure can be applicable to the uplock proximity switch of the main landing gear (Figure 401) or nose landing gear (Figure 402). CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU REMOVE THE HEAT-SHRINKABLE BOOT TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE ELECTRICAL CABLE AND ITS CONNECTOR. (1) For connector that already has heat-shrinkable boot, remove it with a cutting tool. (2) Cut the lockwire (1) or (6), as applicable. (3) Disconnect the electrical connector (3) or (4), as applicable. (4) If the electrical connector (3) or (4) presents signs of damage, contamination or corrosion, do the maintenance procedures on the electrical connector. Refer to AMM TASK 32-60-00-910-801-A/200. (5) Remove the proximity switches (2) or (5), as applicable. NOTE: Remove nut (7) to loosen the proximity switch (5). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-61-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the uplock proximity switch of the landing gear system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL LANDING GEAR PROXIMITY SWITCH AND HAR- AMM TASK 32-60-00-910-801-A/200 NESS ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS - RESTORATION AND PROTECTION PROXIMITY SWITCH (SENSOR) - FUNCTIONAL AMM TASK 32-63-05-700-801-A/500 CHECK PROXIMITY SWITCH (SENSOR) - FUNCTIONAL AMM TASK 32-63-05-700-802-A/500 CHECK - ALTERNATIVE PROCEDURE IPC 32-61-01 UPLOCK PROXIMITY SENSORS SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) lockwire IPC 32-61-01 AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-61-01 Page 6 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (Continued) IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) lockwire IPC 32-61-01 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Nose landing gear or RH or LH MLG com- 1 Does the task partment I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A NOTE: This procedure can be applicable to the uplock proximity switch of the main landing gear (Figure 401) or nose landing gear (Figure 402). (1) Install the proximity switch (2) or (5), as applicable in the uplock box. NOTE: Use nut (7) to attach the proximity switch (5). WARNING: DO NOT GET LUBRICANT AND ANTICORROSIVE FILM PN LEKTRO-TECH SUPER CORR-A IN YOUR MOUTH OR EYES, OR ON YOUR SKIN. PUT ON A PROTECTIVE SPLASH GOGGLE AND GLOVES WHEN YOU USE LUBRICANT AND ANTICORROSIVE FILM PN LEKTRO-TECH SUPER CORR-A. KEEP LUBRICANT AND ANTICORROSIVE FILM PN LEKTRO- TECH SUPER CORR-A AWAY FROM SPARKS, FLAME, AND HEAT. LUBRICANT AND ANTICORROSIVE FILM PN LEKTRO-TECH SUPER CORR-A IS A POISONOUS AND FLAMMABLE SUBSTANCE. (2) Connect the electrical connector (3) or (4), as applicable. NOTE: Before the connection of the connector, apply the Lektro-Tech Super Corr-A into the plug connector to prevent corrosion and to clean the contacts. (3) Safety the proximity switch (2) or (5) with lockwire (1) or (6), as applicable. NOTE: After the installation of the proximity switches, it is not necessary to adjust them. (4) Do the protection of the proximity switch (2) or (5) and the electrical connector (3) or (4) against corrosion. Refer to AMM TASK 32-60-00-910-801-A/200. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do the specific test of the proximity switch. Refer to AMM TASK 32-63-05-700-801- A/500 or AMM TASK 32-63-05-700-802-A/500. (2) On the circuit breaker panel, close the IND 1 and IND 2 circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tags from them. (3) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, remove the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-61-01 Page 7 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-61-01-040-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - DEACTIVATION PROCEDURE A. General (1) This task refers to item 32-60-00 Landing Gear Proximity Switch of the DDPM. (2) It is permitted to dispatch the airplane with one uplock proximity switch and one down lock proximity switch inoperative in each landing gear leg if the remaining proximity switches operate correctly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION PROXIMITY SWITCH (SENSOR) - FUNCTIONAL AMM TASK 32-63-05-700-801-A/500 CHECK C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Nose landing gear or RH or LH MLG com- 1 Does the task partment I. Deactivation Procedure SUBTASK 040-002-A (1) Do the check of the proximity switch. Refer to AMM TASK 32-63-05-700-801-A/500. (2) Write in the aircraft technical logbook that you did the deactivation procedure for the landing gear uplock proximity switch. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 32-61-01 Page 8 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-61-01-440-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - REACTIVATION PROCEDURE A. General (1) This task refers to item 32-60-00 Landing Gear Proximity Switch of the DDPM. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 32-61-01-000-801-A/400 UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - REMOVAL AMM TASK 32-61-01-400-801-A/400 UPLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Nose landing gear or RH or LH MLG com- 1 Does the task partment I. Reactivation Procedure SUBTASK 440-002-A (1) Remove the unserviceable proximity switch. Refer to AMM TASK 32-61-01-000-801-A/ 400. (2) Install a serviceable proximity switch. Refer to AMM TASK 32-61-01-400-801-A/400 (3) Write in the aircraft technical logbook that you did the reactivation procedure for the landing gear uplock proximity switch.
